title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
China's economy descended deeper into Covid-induced doldrums last month, raising questions about whether Beijing can prevent a prolonged downturn.

Buffett's Berkshire has used the slump in markets as an opportunity to ramp up spending on stocks.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell, shedding 0.4% and 1.2%, respectively, while the Dow gained 0.1%.

The price of TerraUSD was down sharply Monday as the cryptocurrency's creator announced a plan to attempt to rescue the project.

A state judge struck down a California law requiring that companies in the state appoint female directors to their boards.

Yellen, in a visit to Warsaw, pushed Poland to advance the EU's implementation of a global minimum tax.

The CEO of Ryanair, one of Boeing's biggest customers, took aim at the plane maker's sales team and its 737 MAX delivery schedule.

KKR said it would sell CHI Overhead Doors to Nucor in a deal that will yield a windfall for CHI's hourly workers.

What's News: Business & Finance
